resources.string: 1. Which of the following statements are NOT true regarding Android Studio? [Android Studio 2.3 is the latest stable release] Android Studio is built specifically for Android development| Android Studio 2.3 is the latest stable release| Android Studio is an IDE (Integrated Development Environment)| Android Studio is built on IntelliJ software| Android Studio can be run on Windows, Mac, and Linux|
2. Which of the following languages are markup languages? [XML] XML| Java| Kotlin| Python| Scratch|
3. Which categories of products can Android apps be developed for? [All of the above] Phones and Tablets| Watches| TVs| Car Systems| All of the above|

4. When coding an Android program, in which location should you put the source of a paragraph of text that is displayed within the app? [As a resource inside the strings.xml file] In its own Java class| In its own Enum| In the MainActivity class as a constant| As a Gradle Script inside the build.gradle file| As a resource inside the strings.xml file|

5. Which of the following demonstrate good naming conventions for XML and Java file names? [activity_main.xml and MainActivity.java] MainActivity.xml and MainActivity.java| activity_main.xml and activity_main.java| main_activity.xml and main_activity.java| activity_main.xml and MainActivity.java| main_activity.xml and MainActivity.java|
6. Which of the following is the latest Android API level as of January 2019? [28] 1| 8| 20| 28| 34|

7. Which methods in the activity lifecycle are automatically called when the device screen is rotated? [onPause, onStop, onDestroy, onCreate, onStart, onResume] No methods are automatically called| onCreate| onPause, onResume| onPause, onStop, onStart, onResume| onPause, onStop, onDestroy, onCreate, onStart, onResume|

8. What is the difference between an argument and a parameter? [Parameters are part of a method definition, while arguments are the actual instances that are passed into the method] They mean the same thing| Arguments only for the main method, parameters are for all other methods| Parameters are part of a method definition, while arguments are the actual instances that are passed into the method| Arguments are part of a method definition, while parameters are the actual instances that are passed into the method| Arguments are arrays, while parameters are single objects|

9. Which of the following statements are NOT true regarding resource IDs? [All resources need IDs attached to them in order to be referenced] Resource IDs can be added to XML tags explicitly| All resources need IDs attached to them in order to be referenced| IDs can be accessed from Java programs using R.id| XML resource files can reference other XML resources by ID| Spaces and some symbols are not allowed in a resource ID|

10. What should be the first line of code in a onCreate method in MainActivity? (Assume savedInstanceState is an object of the Bundle class) [super.onCreate(savedInstanceState);] It does not matter| onCreate();| onCreate(savedInstanceState);| super.onCreate();| super.onCreate(savedInstanceState);|
